cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of list recoverable codes, which have applications in various areas of computer science such as coding theory, compressive sensing, and group testing. The paper specifically focuses on expander codes, which are a type of error-correcting code that have been extensively studied in the coding theory community. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of algorithms for list recovery, which is a topic in the area of algorithms and data structures, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of the rate of the codes, which is a topic in the area of computational complexity, making cs.CC (Computational Complexity) a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of the error-correcting capabilities of the codes, which is a topic in the area of cryptography, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the application of list recoverable codes to list-decoding, which is a topic in the area of signal processing and machine learning, making cs.SI (Signal Processing) a possible sub-category.
